categories.name: Incredible Edibles: Bizarre Foods from Around the World

questions.clue: A favorite in the Philippines, this fertilized duck embryo is boiled and eaten in the shell.
Italy's Casu Marzu is known for containing live insect larvae; it's a cheese from this animal's milk.
Known as the 'King of Fruits,' this spiky, Southeast Asian fruit is infamous for its pungent aroma.
Particularly popular in Mexico, chapulines are these insects seasoned and eaten as a snack.
This Icelandic dish, known as Hákarl, involves the fermentation of the meat of this type of shark.

categories.name: Architectural Feats: Marvels of Modern Engineering

questions.clue: Completed in 1889, this Parisian tower was the world's tallest structure until 1930.
This iconic Australian opera house, completed in 1973, is renowned for its shell-like design.
Opened in 1998, this Malaysian skyscraper was the tallest in the world until 2004.
Known for its spiral design, this Swedish tower is the tallest building in Scandinavia.
Designed by Santiago Calatrava, this futuristic complex in Valencia, Spain includes a planetarium and an opera house.

categories.name: Around the Solar System: Celestial Bodies & Phenomena

questions.clue: This planet, known as the 'Red Planet', is the fourth from the Sun.
These objects, mostly found in a belt between Mars and Jupiter, are rocky remnants from the early solar system.
This largest moon of Saturn is the only moon known to have a dense atmosphere.
This phenomenon occurs when the Moon passes directly between the Earth and the Sun, blocking out the Sun's light.
Discovered in 1846, this blue planet is the farthest known from the Sun in our solar system.
In 'To Kill a Mockingbird,' Scout Finch learns about racism and injustice in 1930s Alabama.
This monster is brought to life by Victor in Mary Shelley's Gothic masterpiece.
George Orwell wrote about a dystopian future with perpetual war and surveillance in this 1949 novel.
Published in 1866, this Fyodor Dostoevsky novel explores the mental anguish of Raskolnikov, a young Russian student.
This epic work, considered James Joyce's masterpiece, takes place over a single day in Dublin.

categories.name: Revolutionary Ideas: Philosophies that Changed History

questions.clue: He wrote 'The Communist Manifesto' with Friedrich Engels in 1848.
This philosopher's idea of separation of powers influenced modern democracies, particularly the United States Constitution.
His 'Theory of Forms' introduced the idea of transcendent forms as the true reality.
This economist's 1776 work 'The Wealth of Nations' laid the foundations for modern free market economics.
This Enlightenment philosopher's concept of the 'General Will' played a key role in the development of democratic thought.

final.clue: Published in 1813, this novel was first titled 'First Impressions' but was renamed to a more well-known title under which it's celebrated today.
